title: Complex Sentences and Clause Structure

vocab.definition: A sentence with one independent clause and one or more dependent clauses
A group of words that can stand alone as a complete sentence
A group of words that cannot stand alone as a sentence
A word that connects a dependent clause to an independent clause
An incomplete sentence missing a subject or predicate

teachingNotes: Practice identifying independent and dependent clauses. Show how subordinating conjunctions create complex sentences.

sample.question: What is a sentence with one independent and one dependent clause?

truefalse.question: A dependent clause can stand alone as a complete sentence.

fillintheblank.question: An incomplete sentence is called a ________.

shortanswer.question: Combine these clauses with a subordinating conjunction: 'I studied hard' and 'I passed the test.'
expectedAny: Because I studied hard, I passed the test
I passed the test because I studied hard
Since I studied hard, I passed the test
